intro: Lasiosiphon carinatus, commonly known as the ridge-seed sida, is a flowering plant native to parts of Africa and the Middle East. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its hairy stems and small, yellowish flowers that bloom in clusters. Its seeds are enclosed in a distinctive, ribbed capsule, giving it its scientific name. It is often found in dry, sandy soils and is adapted to arid environments.
